alert.note: Alert for Baker; Bradford; Clay (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 10 at 3:53PM EDT until further notice by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Florida and southeast Georgia, including the following counties, in Florida, Alachua, Baker, Bradford, Clay, Duval, Nassau, St. Johns and Union. In southeast Georgia, Charlton. * WHEN...Until 600 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 353 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Jacksonville, Saint Augustine, Orange Park, Starke, Keystone Heights, Callahan, Raiford, Mandarin, Middleburg, Arlington, Fruit Cove, Jacksonville International Arpt, Unf, Ponte Vedra Beach, Yulee, Neptune Beach, World Golf Village, Macclenny, Glen St. Mary and Cecil Field. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
